intro: Gagea lutea var. foliosa, commonly known as the leafy star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and clusters of star-shaped, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its bulbs are adapted for survival in arid conditions, storing water and nutrients efficiently. The flowering period occurs in early spring, making it a notable wildflower in its native habitat.
